vehiclesimulationcore
Class WheelGeom

java.lang.Object
  vehiclesimulationcore.WheelGeom
class WheelGeom
extends java.lang.Object

Title: Vehicle Dynamics Simulation Program

Description: vehicle dynmaics, braking system simulation

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2006 Faculty of Information Technology Engineering at Damascus University

WheelGeom class: it holds the wheel geometry transform group and the parant transform group which represensts the coordinate system of the wheel located at it's center it also has the dimension and some related data

so two Transform groups: enables rotaion arroud it's axon not arround the vehicle center

Field Summary
(package private)  javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup coordinateSys
          coordSys is the transform group that represensts the coordinate system of the wheel
(package private)  javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup geom
          geom is the transform group that holds the geometry data, so when we need to transform the wheel relative to it's coordinate system we use it
(package private)  double metalPartRadius
          metalPartRadius, radius of the internal metal part of the wheel, the rubber thivkness is calculated by subtraction, this is used for later use when deformation is considerd
(package private)  double radius
           
(package private)  javax.vecmath.Vector3d rotate
          this vector holds the three values of the rotation component arround the three axis the z value is the rotaional step arround it's axon the y value is used to steer left or right the x value is used in the camper angle, load overload
(package private)  double rubberPartThicknesss
           
(package private)  double thickness
          geometry quantities, the geometrical dimensions of the wheel
(package private)  javax.media.j3d.Transform3D transform
           
 
Constructor Summary
WheelGeom(javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup model)
          constructs using a transform group coming from a loader or anything else that generate the geometry
 
Method Summary
 void resetWheelPos()
          because wheel might change it's rotation or translation values due rotation or suspension, we use this to reset it's position back to it's coordinate system origin
 void rotateWheel(double xVal, double yVal, double zVal)
          rotateWheel, rotate the wheel geometry arround it's parant transform group(coordinateSys) of it's own, rotate arround Y axis
 void rotateWheel(javax.vecmath.Vector3d vec)
          same as above, but passing values inside a vector
 void setDims(double thick, double r, double metalR)
          wheel geom dimension information
 void setTranform(javax.media.j3d.Transform3D trans)
          setTranform, update wheel coordinate system transformgroup, and set the transform local variable this method is better called only when we load the wheel and gather the vehicle parts to set it's coordinate system relative to the vehicle body geom center
 void spinWheel(double zAngle)
          just spin the wheel, rotate arround it's axon, without affecting the other components so only the z rotational component is affected
 void steerWheel(double yAngle)
          rotate arround it's vertical plane, without affecting the other components so only the y rotational component is affected
 void translateWheel(javax.vecmath.Vector3d step)
          for suspension of the vehicle, the wheel might change it's relative position with it's axel
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

rotate

javax.vecmath.Vector3d rotate
this vector holds the three values of the rotation component arround the three axis

the z value is the rotaional step arround it's axon

the y value is used to steer left or right

the x value is used in the camper angle, load overload

Method Detail

setDims

public void setDims(double thick,
                    double r,
                    double metalR)
wheel geom dimension information

Parameters:
thick - double, thickness
r - double, radius
metalR - double, metal part radius

setTranform

public void setTranform(javax.media.j3d.Transform3D trans)
setTranform, update wheel coordinate system transformgroup, and set the transform local variable this method is better called only when we load the wheel and gather the vehicle parts to set it's coordinate system relative to the vehicle body geom center

Parameters:
trans - Transform3D

rotateWheel

public void rotateWheel(double xVal,
                        double yVal,
                        double zVal)
rotateWheel, rotate the wheel geometry arround it's parant transform group(coordinateSys) of it's own, rotate arround Y axis

public void rotateWheel(javax.vecmath.Vector3d vec)
same as above, but passing values inside a vector

Parameters:
vec - Vector3d

spinWheel

public void spinWheel(double zAngle)
just spin the wheel, rotate arround it's axon, without affecting the other components so only the z rotational component is affected

steerWheel

public void steerWheel(double yAngle)
rotate arround it's vertical plane, without affecting the other components so only the y rotational component is affected

translateWheel

public void translateWheel(javax.vecmath.Vector3d step)
for suspension of the vehicle, the wheel might change it's relative position with it's axel

Parameters:
step - Vector3d, translattion steps

resetWheelPos

public void resetWheelPos()
because wheel might change it's rotation or translation values due rotation or suspension, we use this to reset it's position back to it's coordinate system origin
